text.content: Click a Lesson or Activity to learn more about Family Life.
Parenting and family life are being affected by the ever-growing list of special needs diagnoses among young children.

These special needs include:
  • Sensory Integration Disorder
  • Complex food allergies
  • Physical disabilities
  • Disorders on the autism spectrum
Special needs children often generate unique family dynamics.
Every child has unique needs, so many of the teaching strategies you would use to include children with "special needs" are the same as those you would use to meet the needs of any child.
If you feel that this might be beyond your comfort or expertise, consider referring the family to a medical provider or a resource designed to meet the special needs of the family or child.

audio.transcript: Parenting and family life are being affected by the ever-growing list of special needs diagnoses among young children.
These special needs include sensory integration disorder, complex food allergies, physical disabilities, such as visual or hearing impairment, and disorders on the autism spectrum.

Special needs children often generate unique family dynamics. The challenges associated with parenting a special needs child create additional demands on parents in caring for the child. Parents of children with special needs look for resources and support from professionals they trust.

It is important for professionals to remember that every child has unique needs, so many of the teaching strategies you would use to include children with "special needs" are the same as those you would use to meet the needs of any child.
However, if you feel that this might be beyond your comfort or expertise, consider referring the family to a medical provider or a resource designed to meet the special needs of the family or child.
